primaryNavigationEnvironments: I primarily navigate urban streets in downtown areas with heavy pedestrian traffic. I also frequently use public transportation including buses and subway systems. Occasionally I navigate indoor spaces like shopping malls and office buildings.
assistiveDevices: I use a white cane for detecting obstacles at ground level. I also have a guide dog named Max who helps me navigate outdoor environments. I carry a talking GPS device as a backup.
navigationChallenges: My biggest challenges are crossing busy intersections safely, especially when traffic lights don't have audio signals. I also struggle with detecting obstacles at chest or head height like tree branches and construction barriers. Uneven sidewalks and unexpected road work are particularly difficult.
visionProblems: I have complete blindness in both eyes. I lost my vision gradually over the past 5 years due to retinitis pigmentosa. I rely entirely on auditory cues and tactile feedback for navigation.
name: John Doe
otherVisionDefects: I have no color blindness since I have complete vision loss. Before losing my vision, I experienced significant light sensitivity and tunnel vision.
